item.title: Paper Companies Near Big Merger Deal
item.description: WestRock, Smurfit Kappa are in talks to create a company with combined value of roughly $20 billion.

item.title: EUR/USD in Need of Patience Before Central Banks Spark New Triggers
item.description: Various members from the Fed and the ECB are expected to speak Thursday, but it remains to be seen whether these will generate new inputs for EUR/USD, DZ Bank Research said.

item.title: Malaysia's Central Bank Stands Pat, as Expected
item.description: Malaysia’s central bank kept its benchmark interest rate unchanged, maintaining that its current monetary policy stance is in line with the country’s inflation and growth outlook.

item.title: China's Exports Fall for a Fourth Month
item.description: China’s exports to the rest of the world dropped for a fourth straight month in August.

item.title: Airbus's August Aircraft Deliveries Were Solid
item.description: Airbus delivered enough aircraft to customers in August that its own delivery target for the year is now more within reach, Jefferies said, and deliveries for the rest of the year need to be up 2% for it to reach its 720 target.

item.title: Spain's 2030 Inflation-Linked Bond Shows No Concession Ahead of Auction
item.description: Spain’s 1.00% November 2030 inflation-linked bond, which will be tapped on Thursday, has been trading on the firm side lately, Citi said.

item.title: BAT Sells Russian, Belarusian Businesses
item.description: British American Tobacco sold its Russian and Belarusian businesses to a consortium led by members of BAT Russia’s management team for an undisclosed sum.

item.title: Glynn's Take: Lowe Exits RBA Bruised But Still Standing Tall
item.description: Outgoing Reserve Bank of Australia Gov. Philip Lowe used his last official speech urging monetary and fiscal policy makers to work together more closely to steer the economy, and defended his seven-year run at the helm.

item.title: German Industrial Production Falls More Than Expected
item.description: Germany’s industrial output declined 0.8% in July, further dampening hopes of a manufacturing rebound in the country as global demand for its goods weakens.

item.title: U.S., Allies Should Reduce Dependence on China, Speaker McCarthy Says
item.description: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy said China’s Communist Party is to blame for businesses leaving the country and called on the U.S. to work with allies to reduce dependence on Chinese products.

item.title: Nestle to Buy Majority Stake in Grupo CRM
item.description: Nestle said it reached a deal with Advent International to acquire a majority stake in Grupo CRM for an undisclosed sum, in a bid to bolster its confectionery presence in Brazil.

item.title: The Middle East Becomes the World's ATM
item.description: Flush with cash from an energy boom, Saudi Arabia and other Gulf monarchies eager for global influence are having their moment on the world’s financial stage.

item.title: Huawei Hits Back at Apple in China With New High-Speed Phone
item.description: With 5G-like speeds, the device is creating buzz among Chinese fans after Beijing banned the use of iPhones at some government offices.

item.title: In Crimea, Pro-Ukraine Feelings Prompt a Russian Crackdown
item.description: Occupation authorities on the peninsula regularly parade “traitors” on camera, aiming to cow Kyiv-supporting residents into submission.

item.title: The Bank of Canada held its main interest rate steady at 5% after back-to-back rate rises in June and July.
item.description: The Bank of Canada held its main interest rate steady at 5% after back-to-back rate rises in June and July.

item.title: GameStop reported a slight increase in sales and a narrower loss for the fiscal second quarter, as the videogame retailer continued to pursue turnaround efforts.
item.description: GameStop reported a slight increase in sales and a narrower loss for the fiscal second quarter, as the videogame retailer continued to pursue turnaround efforts.

item.title: The Pentagon intends to field a vast network of AI-powered technology, drones and autonomous systems to counter threats from China and other adversaries.
item.description: The Pentagon intends to field a vast network of AI-powered technology, drones and autonomous systems to counter threats from China and other adversaries.

item.title: Google parent Alphabet reached a tentative settlement with a coalition of states to resolve antitrust litigation accusing the company of operating a monopoly with its Google Play app store.
item.description: Google parent Alphabet reached a tentative settlement with a coalition of states to resolve antitrust litigation accusing the company of operating a monopoly with its Google Play app store.

item.title: Comcast and Disney agreed to move up the date on which they begin negotiating the fate of their jointly owned streaming service, Hulu, the cable company's CEO said.
item.description: Comcast and Disney agreed to move up the date on which they begin negotiating the fate of their jointly owned streaming service, Hulu, the cable company’s CEO said.

item.title: Several Binance executives have left the crypto giant in recent days, including leaders overseeing its Russian business and its connections to the traditional financial system.
item.description: Several Binance executives have left the crypto giant in recent days, including leaders overseeing its Russian business and its connections to the traditional financial system.
